    • Constructor Detail

      • MobileOTPVerificationDialog

        public MobileOTPVerificationDialog(@NonNull
                                   android.app.Activity activity,
                                   int challengeType,
                                   double complexity,
                                   java.lang.String mobileNumber,
                                   java.lang.String tradeID,
                                   java.lang.String withdrawalAmt,
                                   java.lang.String withdrawalAddress,
                                   int mobileOTP)
        Parameters:
        activity -
        challengeType - Challenge type for different
        challengeType - == 1.0 == RELEASE_COIN
        challengeType - == 2.0 == CHANGE_PASSWORD
        challengeType - == 3.0 == CHANGE_EMAIL
        challengeType - == 4.0 == FORGOT_PASSWORD
        challengeType - == 5.0 == WITHDRAWAL
        complexity - 2FA Verification Complexity_type will be either 3 or 4
        complexity - == 1 == MNEMONICS
        complexity - == 2 == GOOGLE_AUTH
        complexity - == 3 == MOBILE_OTP
        complexity - == 4 == EMAIL_OTP
        mobileNumber - if @param complexity == 3 == MOBILE_OTP then @param mobileNumber will be displayed on the Screen for the user acknowledgement
        tradeID -
        withdrawalAmt -
        withdrawalAddress -
        mobileOTP -
        mobileOTP - == 1 Display verify MobileOTP
        mobileOTP - == 2 Display Verify EmailOTP

      • onSuccess

        public void onSuccess(java.lang.String url,
                      int code,
                      java.lang.String response,
                      android.app.Activity context)
        Description copied from interface: ResponseListener
        we'll over ResponseListener.onSuccess(String, int, String, Activity) if server will response 200
        Specified by:
        onSuccess in interface ResponseListener
        Parameters:
        url - - return the last api url to check which api data we need to fetch in the given context(Activiyt/Fragment)
        code - - response code Option
        response - - we will get jsonString response and then we will pass to the listener JSONObject challengeVerifyData = new JSONObject(response).getJSONObject("data"); first we will check challengeType if (url.contains(challenge/verify)) { if (status== success){ challengeType == 1.0 == RELEASE_COIN == release coin api ("/seller-release-coin") challengeType == 2.0 == CHANGE_PASSWORD == challengeType == 3.0 == CHANGE_LOGIN == Direct to Home page challengeType == 4.0 == FORGOT_PASSWORD challengeType == 5.0 == WITHDRAWAL == challenge/mnemonic-word } else { check for max try out true/false if (max_try_out_reached) { display alert dialog } else { user can try left max try out number } } } else if (url.contains(/seller-release-coin)) { } else if (url.contains(meta)) { }
        context - - There is no use of Context till now if in future we need context then we can use it
